abstract: Lockdown by security forces in western part of Myanmar in wake of attacks on police officers has prevented aid workers from accessing area; activists from Rohingya ethnic group have accused security forces of waging counterinsurgency campaign against civilians.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Aid work has ceased in the north of Rakhine State after attacks on police officers, and videos purporting to show local Muslims urging jihad have added to fears of unrest.
snippet: Aid work has ceased in the north of Rakhine State after attacks on police officers, and videos purporting to show local Muslims urging jihad have added to fears of unrest....

headline.main: In Western Myanmar, a Lockdown and Fears of More Violence
headline.print_headline: After Myanmar Attacks, a New Surge of Violence
